bibl.note: This document is a bond dated march 13, 1807 in the amount of ten-thousand dollars. Its purpose is for entitling the state of Tennessee to purchase the Patent Right of Eli Whitney's and Phineas Miller's Saw Gin. The bond also outlines the conditions of the obligation.

div1.p: Know all Men by these presents that Mr Eli Whitney & Catharine Miller Executors of Phineas Miller decease are held & firmly bound unto His Excellency John Sevier Governor of the State of Tennessee and his successor in office in the sum of Ten Thousand Dollars, to be paid to the said John Sevier or to his Successors in office. To which payment well and truly to be made. We bind ourselves of each of us, our and each of our Heirs Executors & Administrators firmly by these presents signed with our hands & sealed with our Seals__ Dated this 13th day of March 1807__

Whereas by an Act passed at Knoxville on the 22nd day of October 1803 Entitled an act to purchase for the State of Tennessee the Patent Right of Eli Whitney & Phineas Miller of a Machine or new invention for cleaning of Cotton, commonly called the Saw Gin__

Now the condition of this obligation is
such that if it should hereafter appear that the said Miller of Whitney had not at the time of passing the said Act, and as the time of assigning the said Patent Right to the said State of Tennessee the sole of & exclusive right of making using & vending the said Saw Gin within the State of Tennessee or that any other person had a better right thereto, and that if then in that case of its being made so to appear the said Miller & Whitney or their representatives shall refund any & all monies they may have received from the State of Tennessee by virtue of said Act, then this obligation to be voice, otherwise to remain in full force__
